result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
* AMENDED *  

No contact with any minors under the age of 18 unless supervised by an adult

10:05 AM  Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel. Attorney Michael Becker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin in court with Don Christopher Reinbold, in court, in custody. V/W present. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Atty Perrin comments as to speedy trial and bond request. Based on bond modification DE Waives speedy trial.  State does not object to signature bond. Court amended to signature bond, all other conditions still in place. DE approved by zoom for PTC.  JA to coordinate w/New Lisbon for DE's zoom appearance. Adjourned: 10:09 am
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Settlement conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Settlement conference on November 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on December 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:12 PM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel. Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin in court w/ Defendant Don Christopher Reinbold, in court, in custody.  DE's family members by zoom. S/T former Detective, now Patrol Officer Zachary Schulz, Hudson PD; direct by Atty Ballo. Record reflects identity of the DE. Cross by Atty Perrin. Attys argue bind over. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Adjourned: 3:43 pm.
Arraignment scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Arraignment on September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:33 AM - Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel. Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Travis Satorius appeared for Defendant Don Christopher Reinbold in court. Atty Satorius notes that Atty Perrin has agreed to take this matter, he is appearing for today only. Court find good cause to waive time limits on PH. Court sets PH. Clerk will confirm date / time with Atty Perrin. Bond continues in form and amount. Atty Satorius notes that if DE is transferred back to New Lisbon, DE waives appearance if he could appear by zoom. Court will approve zoom if DE transferred, as well as any family members etc. who would like to appear by zoom as well. Would prefer if Atty Perrin would file a written waiver.   Adjourned: 10:39 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.  (Confirmed w/Atty Perrin)blk
